newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Two bodies found in Belgian sex scandal.
newsitem.headline: Two bodies found in Belgian sex scandal.

text.p: Police searching a property owned by convicted child rapist Marc Dutroux, chief suspect in Belgium's paedophile sex scandal, unearthed two decomposing bodies on Tuesday, a medical source told Reuters.
"They have found two bodies in an advanced state of decomposition," the source said on condition of anonymity. There was no immediate official comment.
The source said the bodies were not of young children but of adolescents or adults.

The Belga news agency, citing a judicial source, said the remains of at least two people had been found at the house in the Charleroi suburb of Jumet formerly occupied by Dutroux accomplice Bernard Weinstein.
Dutroux has said he murdered Weinstein and also admitted kidnapping An Marchal, 17, and Eefje Lambrecks, 19, in the port of Ostend a year ago. The fate of the two girls remains a mystery.
Several other Belgian girls have gone missing in recent years. Their files are all now pooled in Neufchateau, nerve centre of an international paedophile hunt.
